snippet: Fledgling companies are like sticky-fingered toddlers. You've got to watch them every single minute. And yet a small group of women is proving that it's possible to start a high-growth technology company and have children at the same time, reports...
abstract: Fledgling companies are like sticky-fingered toddlers. You've got to watch them every single minute. And yet a small group of women is proving that it's possible to start a high-growth technology company and have children at the same time, reports Hannah Seligson in The New York Times.

headline.main: Nurturing a Baby and a Start-Up Business
